reference.title: refsyn
reference.shortdesc: The <refsyn> element is a special section inside a reference topic. The section often contains syntax or signature content (for example, a command-line utility's calling syntax, or an API's signature). The <refsyn> contains a brief, possibly diagrammatic description of the subject's interface or high-level structure.

section.title: Contains
section.p: The content model of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

section.title: Contained By
section.p: The parents of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

fig.title: Reference topic for software material
fig.codeblock: <reference id="MyAPI"> <title>MyAPI/title> <refbody> <refsyn>Describe the MyAPI syntax here, possibly using synph or syntax elements markup for explicit definition of syntax or prototype construction.</refsyn> </refbody> </reference>
